title: Star Wars - Knights of the Old Republic
notes: Had to edit swkotor.ini's [Graphics Option] section to use Width=1280 Height=1040 EnableHardwareMouse=0 to get it working enough to get through character creation. After that, I was able to adjust the resolution using the in game menu, then restart in order to get a fully working mouse cursor. Everything seems to work through the tutorial, except for videos which are incorrectly sized and have graphical artifacts. Verified on a Windows machine that the videos do not have these issues on that machine, although that machine was using intel integrated graphics not an NVIDIA card.

title: Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic
notes: Had to modify the swkotor.ini, under video AllowWindowedMode=1 and FullScreen=0 then you have to set a resolution of 800x600 to get it to launch. Once in game you can adjsut the resolution but you can't play full screen at all.

title: Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic
notes: Game screen was offset badly upwards, otherwise seemed ok?

title: STAR WARS™ - Knights of the Old Republic™
notes: Edit or add to the file .local/share/Steam/steamapps/common/swkotor/swkotor.ini in the [Graphics Optionis]: AllowWindowedMode=1 FullScreen=0. After adding that the game runs without issue.

title: STAR WARS™: Knights of the Old Republic™

title: STAR WARS™: Knights of the Old Republic™
notes: Start up videos in top left (maybe 640x480). Main menu is mostly black except the top fifth. No controls, requires kill.

title: STAR WARS™: Knights of the Old Republic™
notes:
Have to set windowed mode (edit .local/share/Steam/steamapps/common/swkotor/swkotor.ini). Edit/add the following entries at "[Graphics Options]":
AllowWindowedMode=1
FullScreen=0
Inside the game I alt+enter and alt+enter again to get the mouse working.
Altered the resolution to the max: 1280x1024.
Runs nice after that.

title: STAR WARS™: Knights of the Old Republic™
notes:
Without Meddling: On Startup only bottom half viewable, videos are only shown in the upper left corner. 
With Meddling: If you add the following lines to swkotor.ini under [Graphics Options]
Width=1280
Height=1024
the mouse will be registered too low. This goes away after entering a savegame/newgame. The Bug persists during character creation.

If Frame Buffer is activated, the workaround works, but the Picture gets corrupted. If Frame Buffer is deactivated, the screen and the hud are too high.

The Frame Buffer Picture bug only appears with the newest mesa driver, with the standard ubuntu driver, the picture works fine.

title: STAR WARS™: Knights of the Old Republic™
notes:
As confirmed by other testers: setting the resolution to 1280x1024 in the config file will render the game window properly. I also had graphics glitches when frame buffer effects were turned on.

To fix the mouse being off-centre: go to swkotor.ini and change EnableHardwareMouse to '0' under [Graphics Options]. However, disabling the frame buffer will make it off-centre again (though not as severely as before).

gpu: Intel Open Source Technology Center Mesa DRI Intel(R) Ivybridge Mobile x86/MMX/SSE2
notes: added AllowWindowedMode=1 and Fullscreen=0 to swkotor.ini  When I launch I have to change screen resolution in options and it works perfect in a window every time.  If I do not change screen resolution when I launch the game it crashes .  oh and EnableHardwareMouse=1 also in swkotor.ini.  just have to change from 1280x1024 and back again in options upon launch.  Does not work fullscreen
